sections.title: Foreign Currency Markup Fee
rules: A foreign currency markup is charged when you make an international transaction in a currency other than INR.
The markup fee is typically 3.5% of the transaction amount, plus applicable GST.
This fee applies to both online international transactions and POS transactions outside India.
The final amount posted to your card includes the base transaction value, markup fee, and GST.
Card networks like Visa or Mastercard may apply additional conversion charges.
examples: If you spend $100 internationally and the exchange rate is ₹85 per USD, the base amount is ₹8,500. A 3.5% markup adds ₹297.50, plus GST.
A ₹1,000 international subscription (converted value) will incur a markup of ₹35 (3.5%) plus GST.
notes: Markup is charged even if the online merchant is Indian but processes payments through a foreign gateway.
Refunds for international transactions may take longer due to network-level processing.
